securityDB

Class SecurityDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • securityDB.SecurityDB

  • public class SecurityDB
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the interface to post surveillance videos, and raise alarm event to the security database. In order to use this API, make sure the mySQL JDBC driver is included as a jar lib.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jordan Brack, Haofan Zheng

      A enum used as a return type for RaiseAlarm method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SecurityDB

        public SecurityDB(java.lang.String address,
                  java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password,
                  java.lang.String cameraUID)
           throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                  java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                  java.sql.SQLException
        The constructor for the SercurityDB class. The constructor will try to connect to the database. if the connection is successfully established, the connection will be maintained during the runtime. If the connection is failed, exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        address - The database address including the port number and schema name. (eg. example.com:[port number here]/[schema name here])
        username - The username used to connect to the database.
        password - The password for that user.
        cameraUID - The UID of the camera that will be associated with this instance. The UID can be found on the webpage portal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException - Thrown when failed to create a instance of the mySQL JDBC driver.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - Thrown when failed to create a instance of the mySQL JDBC driver.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Thrown when failed to create a instance of the mySQL JDBC driver.
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown when failed to connect to the database.

    • Method Detail

      • PostVideo

        public SecurityDB.PostVideoErrorType PostVideo(java.util.Date startTime,
                                               long durationMicroSec,
                                               byte[] thumbnailData,
                                               byte[] videoData,
                                               int resolutionWidth,
                                               int resolutionHeight,
                                               java.lang.String videoFormat)
        Post a video to the database.
        Parameters:
        startTime - The start time (including date and time) of the video.
        durationMicroSec - The duration of the video in micro-second.
        thumbnailData - The binary data array of the thumbnail file (in *.png format) of this video.
        videoData - The binary data array of the video file.
        resolutionWidth - The resolution width of the video.
        resolutionHeight - The resolution height of the video.
        videoFormat - The format of the video (eg. *.mp4, *.mov, etc.)
        Returns:
        The result of posting a video.

      • RaiseAlarm

        public SecurityDB.RaiseAlarmErrorType RaiseAlarm(java.util.Date startTime,
                                                 java.util.Date endTime)
        Raise a new alarm to the security database. The spot of this alarm is same the spot of the camera that is associated with this instance.
        Parameters:
        startTime - The start time of the alarm.
        endTime - The end time of the alarm.
        Returns:
        The result of raising a alarm.

      • RaiseAlarm

        public SecurityDB.RaiseAlarmErrorType RaiseAlarm(java.util.Date startTime,
                                                 int durationSec)
        Raise a new alarm to the security database. The spot of this alarm is same the spot of the camera that is associated with this instance.
        Parameters:
        startTime - The start time of the alarm.
        durationSec - The duration of the alarm.
        Returns:
        The result of raising a alarm.

      • GetLastErrorMessage

        public final java.lang.String GetLastErrorMessage()
        Get the error message from the last execution of PostVideo or RaiseAlarm. This error message is set to empty at the beginning of the execution of PostVideo and RaiseAlarm. And this error message will only be set when a SQLException was caught inside the PostVideo or RaiseAlarm method.
        Returns:
        The error message from the last execution of PostVideo or RaiseAlarm.
